channel.title: Lily of the Valley
channel.description:
It looks like to me RuneScape is/has been using a nice little method for not just them to take care of bots but others to take care of bots, it seems this item that is growing around RuneScape on some times depending when it's wanted by Jagex, members are allowed to trick a bot and put it in their inventory and when clicking on 'operate' it makes the other do an emote.
Thoughts?

item.title: Lily of the Valley
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Skyro:

What does accept aid do, I’ve always thought it heals your Hp Faster hence the icon.

It allows other players to do shit to you, such as when another player uses the ‘teleother’ teleport on you (of course upon your confirmation).

Read full topic

item.title: Lily of the Valley
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

… Lily of the Valley was never put in place as a defensive mechanism against bots… It was just to celebrate spring.

Read full topic

Skyro:

What does accept aid do, I’ve always thought it heals your Hp Faster hence the icon.

INB4SOMEBODY’SIGNATURE

item.title: Lily of the Valley
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:13, topic:441084”][quote author=BloodRayne link=topic=543761.msg3986164#msg3986164 date=1335914086]
Accept aid is off by default when you create an account, and 99% of bots that are gathering resources have never been played by a human, therefore it’s still off

And if you’re in the wild and you notice them appearing in your inventory, turn off accept aid… lol
[/quote]
common sense saves the day![/quote]
True, but remember who reads half of this stuff?

Read full topic

item.title: Lily of the Valley
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:11, topic:441084”]Accept aid is off by default when you create an account, and 99% of bots that are gathering resources have never been played by a human, therefore it’s still off

And if you’re in the wild and you notice them appearing in your inventory, turn off accept aid… lol[/quote]
common sense saves the day!

Read full topic

item.title: Lily of the Valley
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:7, topic:441084”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=543761.msg3985753#msg3985753 date=1335843874]
Of course, what I find to be a nice update for spring ends up being yet another plot to end bots…
[/quote]

has been around for ages.[/quote]
I know

Read full topic

item.title: Lily of the Valley
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Accept aid is off by default when you create an account, and 99% of bots that are gathering resources have never been played by a human, therefore it’s still off

And if you’re in the wild and you notice them appearing in your inventory, turn off accept aid… lol

Read full topic

item.title: Lily of the Valley
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“frozon566, post:9, topic:441084”][quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=543761.msg3985853#msg3985853 date=1335868812]

Why would it mess a bot up? All the bot knows is that it isn’t clicking, so it will click again.

It would mess up the bots because sometimes depending if the item can be placed into the bank like I know the tickets for Sequel of Fortune cannot, that item would be in the inventory with all 28 slots so the bot would have to drop it all.

It also makes them do an emote if the other person that gave it to them clicked ‘operate’.
[/quote]

Couldn’t it be used in PKing then?[/quote]
Good question, but that could also be abused, I’m sure this item if for ALL people, which in any case why is this added when it can be abused with regular members as well towards others, it’s quite stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: Lily of the Valley
item.dc:creator: @frozon566 frozon566
item.description:
@frozon566 wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:8, topic:441084”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=543761.msg3985725#msg3985725 date=1335840956]
Why would it mess a bot up? All the bot knows is that it isn’t clicking, so it will click again.
[/quote]
It would mess up the bots because sometimes depending if the item can be placed into the bank like I know the tickets for Sequel of Fortune cannot, that item would be in the inventory with all 28 slots so the bot would have to drop it all.

It also makes them do an emote if the other person that gave it to them clicked ‘operate’.[/quote]

Couldn’t it be used in PKing then?

Read full topic

frozon566:

i’ve never heard of this, but as long as you babysit your bot there shouldn’t be a problem right?
